*Ignored components*:
  * olfactory cortex

= Connections =

  * HCA.ET (inferior input) – receives inputs from complex multisensory and higher order association areas of cerebral cortex via PCA.PCG
  * HCA.FX (superior input) – receives:
   * ACh fibers from basal forebrain (septal nuclei and basal nucleus of Meynert) - *Novelty*
   * DA fibers from ventral tegmental area of the midbrain - *Reward*
   * 3HT fibers from raphe nuclei (midline pons and midbrain) - *Mood*
   * NE fibers from the locus ceruleus (floor of fourth ventricle) - *Attention*

= Citations =

{{{
- HCA.PH.PR is not important for object perception, but functions only in object memory
- HCA.HC and HCA.SUB are 3-layered cortices with prominent middle pyramidal layer
- HCA.DG is 3-layered cortex with a prominent middle granular layer
- afferent fibers from HCA.FX and HCA.ET terminate on either pyramidal cells of HCA.HC directly or 
  on granule cells of HCA.DG which then project to pyramidal cells of HCA.HC
- HCA.HC.CA1, HCA.HC.CA3 have LTP property, but HCA.HC.CA2 does not
- HCA.HC.CA2 has highly significant difference in membrane potential from CA1, and it is more negative
- HCA.EC (L2) -> (HCA.HC.CA1) -> HCA.HC.CA3
- HCA.EC (L3) -> (HCA.HC.CA2) -> HCA.HC.CA1
}}}
